org.apache.lucene.util

Class NumericUtils.LongRangeBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.lucene.util.NumericUtils.LongRangeBuilder
  • Enclosing class:
    NumericUtils

    public abstract static class NumericUtils.LongRangeBuilder
extends Object
    Callback for NumericUtils.splitLongRange(org.apache.lucene.util.NumericUtils.LongRangeBuilder, int, long, long). You need to overwrite only one of the methods.
    Since:
    2.9, API changed non backwards-compliant in 4.0
    NOTE: This API is for internal purposes only and might change in incompatible ways in the next release.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NumericUtils.LongRangeBuilder() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addRange(BytesRef minPrefixCoded, BytesRef maxPrefixCoded)
      Overwrite this method, if you like to receive the already prefix encoded range bounds.
      void addRange(long min, long max, int shift)
      Overwrite this method, if you like to receive the raw long range bounds.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • NumericUtils.LongRangeBuilder

        public NumericUtils.LongRangeBuilder()

    • Method Detail

      • addRange

        public void addRange(BytesRef minPrefixCoded,
            BytesRef maxPrefixCoded)
        Overwrite this method, if you like to receive the already prefix encoded range bounds. You can directly build classical (inclusive) range queries from them.

      • addRange

        public void addRange(long min,
            long max,
            int shift)
        Overwrite this method, if you like to receive the raw long range bounds. You can use this for e.g. debugging purposes (print out range bounds).
